meanings.definition: To build or set up again
meanings.sent1: After the storm, they had to reerect their tent for shelter.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew will reerect the fallen fence tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reerect a sandcastle after the wave destroyed it is a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She had to reerect her confidence after the setback at work.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to reerect the playground that was damaged in the fire.

meanings.definition: To restore to an upright position
meanings.sent1: The volunteers helped reerect the fallen street sign.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to reerect the car on the lift to fix the issue.
meanings.sent3: It was comical to watch the cat try to reerect its knocked-over toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a strong wind, reerecting her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor guided the students to reerect their spines for proper posture.
